page.title: 18CLUBS
page.content: Much of this section is rural so many of the clubs follow outdoor pursuits. Given hard frost,members of{Penicuik {Curling Club}(founded in 1815) gather at the Low Pond to participate in club games,competitions and bonspiels.The first Grand Match took place in 1847 on the High Pond.From August to January the{Edinburgh Sporting Club {Shooting Syndicate}stalk rabbits,hares and specially reared grouse and pheasant.Following fliers of a different type at Harlaw Moor are members of the{Model Aeroplane Club. {Cubs,Scouts,Guides,Brownies & Boys' {Brigade}hike,camp and canoe at Penicuik Estate.{The Hunter & Lass {Association}hold the traditional ride out there in June.Monthly outings are arranged by the{Ramblers'Group}while the{Harriers'Athletic Club}members run locally and at other clubs.
